thread.title: France: International and domestic tourist numbers grow
thread.title_full: France: International and domestic tourist numbers grow

author: eTN Global Editor
title: France: International and domestic tourist numbers grow
text:
France: International and domestic tourist numbers grow Adv: 
Jul 15, 2015 Adv: 
PARIS, France - The summer season has started rather well for tourism in France with an overall increase in tourist numbers. The amount of visitors coming to the country is expected to be at least equivalent to that of summer 2014. However, the data also show that more and more French travelers explore their homeland. 
According to the 1st wave of a cyclical survey conducted by the Tourism Offices of France, Rn2D, ANMSM and Atout France, the number of French tourists traveling around their home country is expected to grow during the summer of 2015, as well as the number of foreign visitors. 
The survey reported a "good general dynamic" for the start of the season between April 15 and June 15, 2015. It is "particularly characterized by the French clientele". 
The tourist numbers are generally higher than for the same period in 2014. Especially on Brittany's, Norman’s and Northerner’s coasts and in many provincial cities as well as in the whole of the South-East the services providers report increased amount of bookings. 
The British remain the most numerous group of international tourists coming to France. They are followed by the Belgians, the Dutch, the Germans and the Italians. Other visitors such as the Russians, the Canadians, the Chinese and the Japanese are on the increase as well.
